articles.content:
A ban on menthol cigarettes comes into action in the UK on 20 May.
The ban, which includes the sale of all tobacco that contains flavourings, is part of an effort to stop younger people from smoking and reducing the number of people taking up smoking overall… [+1875 chars]

articles.author: Aishwarya Dharni
articles.title: New Claim: Antibodies Of 4-YO Llama Named Winter Could Help Humanity Recover From COVID-19 - India Times
articles.description: Four-year-old llama named Winter who lives at a research farm in Belgium along with 130 other llamas and alpacas. All of them produce a special class of disease-resistant antibodies that help in binding the spiky proteins that stud the surface of the coronavi…
articles.content:
With over 200 countries affected by the deadly COVID-19 pandemic, almost everyone is working tirelessly to find a cure. Now a new study claims that a llama's antibodies could help neutralise the virus.
According to an ANI report, the animal mentioned is a fo… [+3292 chars]

articles.author: Staff Reporter
articles.title: Vaccines May Not Work on New Mutant Strain of Coronavirus Spreading in US and Europe – Study - Science Times
articles.description: A newly discovered coronavirus mutation may be "immune" to vaccines currently being tested. It is of urgent concern to the medical community, which is searching for a vaccine that will work against COVID-19.

articles.author: Uwagbale Edward-Ekpu
articles.title: Kenyan-British mosquito scientists use microbe to stop malaria - Quartz Africa
articles.description: Scientists believe the Microsporidia MB is a candidate as an eco-friendly and sustainable strategy to replace harmful mosquito populations with harmless ones
articles.content:
Scientists in Kenya have discovered a novel method with significant potential to completely stop mosquitos from transmitting the parasites which cause malaria in humans.
The team of scientists, mostly from Kenya and the UK, plus one from South Africa, have b… [+3126 chars]

articles.author: FE Online
articles.title: COVID-19: CSIR submits 53 genome sequences of coronavirus in Indians to global body; to submit 450 more by May 15 - The Financial Express
articles.description: The Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) is also planning to submit additional 450 genome sequence data of coronavirus by May 15, its Director General Shekhar Mande said.
articles.content: Amidst concerns that coronavirus have undergone mutation and the new strain maybe more contagious, India’s premier R&D organisation, CSIR, has submitted as many as 53 genome sequences of the virus to a global genome database, a move that may help in bette… [+3396 chars]

articles.author: Agencies
articles.title: How bats carry coronavirus without getting sick decoded by scientists - Business Standard
articles.description: In the study, the scientists demonstrated that cells from an insect-eating brown bat can be persistently infected with MERS coronavirus for months
articles.content:
Scientists have uncovered how bats can carry the MERS coronavirus without getting sick, shedding light on what triggers coronaviruses, including the one behind the Covid-19 pandemic, to jump to humans.
